intro: Ferula schugnanica, commonly known as the Schugnan ferula, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and feathery leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. Its roots are thick and fibrous, often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Ferula schugnanica thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
